name: Elite Hotel Savoy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed in this lovely hotel for one night on 15th June, 2010. I was on a business trip to Malmo. I stayed in a business suite and it was worth the amount paid for my stay there. The elegant hotel has all the facilities for business meetings, though I had a meeting at different place. I would recommend this hotel for both business as well as leisure stay.
reviews.title: . I would recommend this hotel for both business as well as leisure stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The staff was very courteous and cooperative.
reviews.title: For being an Elite, it does not live up to its name

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location. Across the street is the train station. Around the corner and you are on your way to downtown so it is walking distance, The rooms are ok.Very average. expected much more since it is Elite Hotel. Some floors are in between the floors that have elevator stops so you have to carry your suitcase and it is couple of stairs to carry. Hopefully you know what i mean. its like the elevator stops every other floor.Remember however this is an old building so i guess this is the best they could do.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed here for one night in one of the junior suites and thought it was fantastic. The staff were very helpful and the room was amazing. The location is perfect for meandering through the centre. I will definitely be coming back to stay, couldn't have asked for more.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at the Savoy about 10 times the past years, both in business and together with my family.
reviews.title: Tried to book but they had weird policys!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008
reviews.text: I stayed at the Savoy for a business trip. It was perfectly located within walking distance from the Central train station...even in the snow :-). It was a clean hotel with a friendly staff. Staying with colleagues, it seemed the room sizes weren't consistent even though we all booked the same class of room. My room was comfortable and roomy and I was pleased. It is centrally located to a lot of things you can do in Malmo and walkable from pretty much everywhere.
reviews.title: Great hotel convenient in Malmo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was an unexpected surprise. I booked it strictly because it is across the street from the train station and we needed a place to stay for a night when coming back on the train from Stockholm. It was lovely.
reviews.title: Charming little getaway

likes.liked: — It felt like a high class hotel with a small hotel charm to it.
likes.disliked: — Some of the rooms have a maze of hallways to get there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and had a reasonable amount of space in them. If you know you will be there, there are definite deals available on their website too.
reviews.title: Old World Charm in Malmo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Malmo was a nice town to visit and this was a great location and hotel to stay in while there. The breakfast was also very nice and the room was large and inviting.
reviews.title: No Romance at the Savoy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: A weekend away in Malmo is now a much more attractive and affordable option thanks to easy access from Ryanair flights and the marvelous train connection to and from Copenhagen.
reviews.title: Stompin' at the Savoy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed at the the Savoy for two nights and it evokes an air of days-gone-by, and dates back to the nineteenth century. It's a bit of a rabbit warren to the bedroom, and mine was quite small with two cupboards - one containing the shower, the other the WC and basin.
reviews.title: Quirky charm, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: The breakfast was - I was going to say "served" - but it's buffet style in the brasserie.
reviews.title: Probably one of the best sleeps in my life!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Perfect location for shopping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Location is perfect - opposite the station, and midway between the old town with its lovely squares and parks, and the up and coming ex-docklands with its interesting architecture and walks along the water's edge. From 2011, the train journey from Copenhagen will be cut by 20 minutes as a major tunnelling project is under way.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel both for business and for pleasure!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would have liked to have stayed another day - there was so much to explore. Will definitely go back.
reviews.title: Great place, really great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I throughly enjoyed my stay at the Elite Savoy. It could use a little TLC in a few places but overall it is very nice. The staff were all excellent and spoke very good English. It is located directly across from the Central train station. Just have to cross the bridge at the light and walk half a block to the front door. The departure point for the canal tour is also directly across the street. The breakfast was excellent. What I liked best was the fresh fruit. It still had the rind on the watermelon and pineapple so you knew it did not come from a can. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was nicely outfitted. The room was not a bad size. And surprise, surprise you were not limited to watching CNN or BBC world in the evening after a long day of sightseeing. There are a number of channels that are in English subtitled in Swedish. Most all sights are within easy walking distance of the hotel. The hotel offers free wifi you just have to get a code from the front desk. It is good for 3 hours from the time you login. If you need more time you just have to get another code from the front desk. I would definitely not hesitate in recommending this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Location and an excellent boutique style hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: Nice and fiendly staff with service in there minds all the time.
reviews.title: Splendid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had the suit....
reviews.title: Elegant and very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The french brasserie was splendid
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff. Top marks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for two nights and it was wonderful.
reviews.title: Good Hotel with Odd Layout

description: With an intriguing history dating back to the 14th century, the carefully restored Elite Hotel Savoy is well positioned in the heart of Malmö, opposite the Central Train Station. The restaurant Café le fil du Rasoir at Hotel Savoy is a French style steakhouse and at the Bishop’s Arms pub guests can experience a wide selection of genuine British whiskies and beers. Elite Hotel Savoy is well known for its beautiful and carefully restored rooms, comfortably equipped with many facilities including cable TV. All guests can enjoy complimentary wireless internet throughout the hotel.
